title: Christian Moueix
text:
Christian Moueix (; born 1946) is a French <a href="winemaker">winemaker</a> and the president of the "<a href="n%C3%A9gociant">négociant</a>" house <a href="%C3%89tablissements%20Jean-Pierre%20Moueix">Établissements Jean-Pierre Moueix</a> in <a href="Libourne">Libourne</a>, overseeing production in several estates in <a href="Saint-%C3%89milion%20AOC">Saint-Émilion</a> and <a href="Pomerol">Pomerol</a> including <a href="Ch%C3%A2teau%20La%20Fleur-P%C3%A9trus">Château La Fleur-Pétrus</a> and <a href="Ch%C3%A2teau%20Trotanoy">Château Trotanoy</a>. He has managed the company since his father <a href="Jean-Pierre%20Moueix">Jean-Pierre Moueix</a> stepped down in 1991.
Early life.
Christian Moueix was born in 1946, the son of <a href="Jean-Pierre%20Moueix">Jean-Pierre Moueix</a>.
Career.
Moueix also owns <a href="Dominus%20Estate">Dominus Estate</a> in <a href="Napa%20Valley%20AVA">Napa Valley, California</a>. Upon a recommendation by <a href="Robert%20Mondavi">Robert Mondavi</a> to establish production in Napa Valley, Moueix entered into a partnership with Robin Lail and Marcia Smith in 1982 on the historic Napanook Vineyards estate and became the sole owner of the property in 1995.
In 2008, Moueix was chosen the "Man of the Year" by the wine magazine "<a href="Decanter%20%28magazine%29">Decanter</a>".
Personal life.
Moueix is married to Cherise. He has two children from a previous marriage, Edouard, who has worked for JPM since about 2005, and Charlotte, a wildlife vet in South Africa.
Art collectors.
Moueix and his wife Cherise are well-known art collectors. In 2014, she sold <a href="Mark%20Rothko">Mark Rothko</a>'s "No. 6 (Violet, Green and Red)" to <a href="Yves%20Bouvier">Yves Bouvier</a> through an intermediary for $80 million plus an unspecified commission, which Bouvier then sold to <a href="Dmitry%20Rybolovlev">Dmitry Rybolovlev</a> for €140 million.
